title: SEO Basics - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Stephen Nelson February 27, 2015 Recovering from Google Algorithmic Penalties: A Small Business Tells Its Story SEO Basics | Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Getting dinged by Google penalties doesn't have to be an entirely painful process, provided business owners accept the occurrences as opportunities for meaningful change. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 24, 2015 15 SEO Best Practices for Structuring URLs Technical SEO | SEO Basics URL BEST PRACTICES - It's been a long time since we covered one of the most fundamental building blocks of SEO--the structure of domain names and URLs--and I think it's high time to revisit. Read this post By: Matthew Egan February 18, 2015 How To Use Vanity URLs and Avoid SEO Self-Cannibalization Technical SEO | SEO Basics | User Experience (UX) Vanity URLs are a useful, creative way to expand the reach of your brand while retaining the SEO-integrity of your main web domain. Read this post By: Ruth Burr Reedy February 18, 2015 Hiring for SEO: How to Find and Hire Someone with Little or No Experience Marketing Industry | SEO Basics SEOs are in high demand, but that doesn't mean you can't find a newbie and train them up. Find out what you should be looking for when hiring an inexperienced SEO for your team. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin February 6, 2015 Subdomains vs. Subfolders, Rel Canonical vs. 301, and How to Structure Links for SEO Content Marketing | Whiteboard Friday | SEO Basics Subfolders or subdomains? 301 redirect or rel canonical? What about optimal link structures for SEO? Some of the basic questions are the ones that crop up the most frequently, and in today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand tackles those three. Read this post By: Cyrus Shepard February 2, 2015 Google's Sitelinks Search Box: What You Need to Know On-page SEO | Technical SEO | SEO Basics Several months ago, Google announced a new sitelinks search box. Despite its strong adoption, until now we've had very little evidence to understand its effects. We implemented it to share with you the results. Here's what we found... Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 30, 2015 A Universal SEO Strategy Audit in 5 Steps SEO Basics | Whiteboard Friday Starting your SEO strategy with questions only works if you're asking the right questions. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand covers the five that'll lead you in the wrong direction, and the five steps you should be taking instead. Read this post By: Jeremy_Gottlieb January 28, 2015 How to do Keyword Research in 90 Minutes Keyword Research | SEO Basics Using a hypothetical client, Jeremy Gottlieb shows you just how much keyword research you can get done in 90 minutes (and walks you step-by-step through how to do it). Read this post By: Charlene Ditch January 22, 2015 5 Years of SEO Changes and Better Goal-Setting - Videos from MozTalk 2 SEO Basics | SEO Events These videos are from the second in our series of free presentations at the Mozplex called MozTalks. For those who couldn't attend the last one with Rand and Dr. Pete (or those who'd like to see them again!), we've got you covered. Enjoy, and we hope that you're able to make the next MozTalk! Read this post By: Isla McKetta December 31, 2014 The Best of the Best: Celebrating the Top 10 of the Moz Top 10 for 2014 Content Marketing | SEO Basics We've curated the very best digital marketing content from 2014. Find out who tops this year-end edition of the Moz Top 10 and how you can be a part of the fun. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 26, 2014 The Massive Ranking Factor Too Many SEOs are Ignoring SEO Basics | Whiteboard Friday There's an incredibly important ranking factor that SEOs just aren't paying enough attention to, and Rand (as Randa Claus) is here to fill you in with a very special episode of White*beard* Friday. Read this post By: Richard Foulkes December 22, 2014 A Step-by-Step Guide to Updating Your Website Without Destroying Your SEO Technical SEO | SEO Basics Redesigning a website is one of the most neglected areas of online marketing. Often, the right parties are not involved, or they are involved too late, leading to errors, omissions or drastic decreases in site traffic. Don't allow your business to fall into this trap. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers December 17, 2014 Marketing Resolutions: Moving from Lag to Lead SEO Consulting | SEO Basics It's that time again - time to repeat the insanity of setting audacious marketing goals for next year with no plan for how to achieve them. How can we go from looking backward (lag) to charting a path forward (lead)? Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 12, 2014 How to Avoid the Unrealistic Expectations SEOs Often Create Whiteboard Friday | SEO Basics Making promises about SEO results too often leads to broken dreams and shredded contracts. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand shows us how to set expectations that lead to excitement but help prevent costly misunderstandings. Read this post
